Questions Page - Previous and Next button
column26: Users need to navigate through the survey easily while being encouraged to complete each section fully before moving to the next.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user of the survey

*I want…*to use previous and next buttons to navigate through the survey sections

*So that…*I can easily move between different sections of the survey while ensuring I complete each section before moving on.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

* Implementation of previous and next buttons for navigation
* validation to ensure the current section is completed before allowing navigation to the next section.



Out of scope:

Any other navigation methods beyond the previous and next buttons
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user clicks the "Next" button without completing all required questions in the current section,
* *Then* the user should receive an error message indicating that they must complete all questions before proceeding.



* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user clicks the "Next" button after completing all required questions in the current section,
* *Then* the user should be taken to the next section of the survey.



* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user clicks the "Previous" button,
* *Then* the user should be taken to the previous section of the survey without any validation checks.



* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user navigates to the next section after completing the current section,
* *Then* their progress should be saved, and they should not lose any entered data.



* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user tries to navigate to the next section,
* *Then* any unanswered required questions in the current section should be highlighted with error messages.



* *Given* the survey page,
* *When* the user navigates back to a previously completed section using the "Previous" button,
* *Then* they should be able to see and edit their previous responses.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column1: Questions Page - Radio buttons with text
column26: Users need a simple and efficient way to respond to multiple-choice questions in the survey.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user of the survey

*I want…*to answer survey questions using radio buttons

*So that…*I can easily select my responses for each question
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

-Implementing radio buttons for each question, allowing users to select only one answer per question.

All the final questions and answers are [here|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uvIrgFG5_IJtTflKCWOv7W1QagR6S-EqqjD0TfZaBlE/edit#gid=344589132].



Out of scope:

-Other types of answer inputs (e.g., text fields, checkboxes).
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

* *Given* a survey question is displayed,
* *When* the user selects an answer using the radio button,
* *Then* the selection is recorded and stored.



* *Given* a survey question with multiple radio buttons,
* *When* the user tries to select more than one answer,
* *Then* only the most recent selection is recorded, and previous selections are deselected.



* *Given* a survey question,
* *When* the user tries to proceed without selecting an answer,
* *Then* an error message is displayed, indicating that an answer is required.
{panel}

column26:
To "push" data into another system Contentful provides [+webhooks+|https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/webhooks/]. These are HTTP requests that are made when you create/update an entry. Their payload includes information about the updated entry.

To feed our database we need some logic in between Contentful and our database. 
Set up an HTTP endpoint that is able to modify transform the database. This endpoint can then retrieve the information of updated Contentful content and modify our database.

Helpful links:
[https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/webhooks/overview/|https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/webhooks/overview/|smart-link]

*Scope:* The technical spike aims to research and explore the feasibility of implementing an AI-powered personalised roadmap component within the Client Partnerships (CP) dashboard. This spike will focus on understanding the technical requirements, potential challenges, and available tools and technologies to develop and integrate AI capabilities for generating personalised recommendations based on survey results and input data.



*Research Objectives:*

# *Technical Feasibility Assessment:* Evaluate the technical feasibility of implementing AI algorithms to analyse survey data and generate personalised recommendations for client partnerships.
# *Data Integration:* Investigate methods for integrating survey results and client input data into the AI-powered personalized roadmap generation process.
# *AI Model Selection:* Research and compare available AI models and algorithms suitable for generating personalized recommendations based on survey insights and client attributes.
# *Scalability and Performance:* Assess the scalability and performance considerations associated with implementing AI capabilities within the CP dashboard, considering factors such as data volume, processing time, and resource requirements.
# *Integration with CP Dashboard:* Explore options for seamlessly integrating the AI-powered personalised roadmap component into the existing CP dashboard infrastructure, ensuring compatibility and usability.
# *Data Privacy and Security:* Evaluate data privacy and security measures required to protect sensitive client information and survey results used in the AI-powered personalised roadmap generation process.



*Expected Deliverables:*

* Technical feasibility report outlining findings and recommendations for implementing AI-powered personalised roadmap functionality within the CP dashboard.
* Identification of potential challenges, limitations, and risks associated with the proposed solution.
* Recommendations for AI model selection, data integration strategies, scalability considerations
* Integration plan, including data flow, processing pipeline, and system components.
* Data privacy and security recommendations
* Tasks/user stories to implement

column335:
10/May/24 11:39 AM;6294f4fd1a2bdf0070942111;There’s a few ways to integrate Contentful with PostgreSQL

# Query Contentful content delivery API from BE:
Contenful offers 2 API’s. The Content Delivery API (CDA), available at [http://cdn.contentful.com|http://cdn.contentful.com|smart-link] , is a read-only API for delivering content from Contentful. Content is delivered as JSON data, and images, videos and other media as files.
Contentful's Content Management API (CMA), can be used to deliver and manage content (read-write-delete access)
# Contentful webhooks + ARS API endpoints:
Contentful provides [+webhooks+|https://www.contentful.com/developers/docs/concepts/webhooks/]. These are HTTP requests that are made when you create/update an entry. Their payload includes information about the updated entry. To feed the database we'd need some logic in between Contentful and our database (like an HTTP endpoint that is able to modify transform the database).
# Paid apps for integration:
There are number of apps like: [n8n|https://n8n.io/integrations/contentful/and/mysql/], [appypie|https://www.appypie.com/integrate/apps/contentful/integrations/postgresql], [portable.io|https://portable.io/connectors/contentful/postgresql] that offer integrations between Contenful and postgreSQL. Contentful has a tutorial on how to do this using an app Hasura: [https://www.contentful.com/blog/combining-contentful-graphql-postgres-hasura/|https://www.contentful.com/blog/combining-contentful-graphql-postgres-hasura/|smart-link]  
# GraphQL schema stitching:
GraphQL API’s are composable, so one could take multiple GraphQL APIs and unify them into one. Stitching is an approach that let’s you have unified, transparent access to multiple GraphQL APIs. This can make it easier to access data that is split across multiple APIs without understanding where exactly it’s located. If all your APIs use GraphQL it’s possible to [combine everything in one API|https://www.contentful.com/blog/combining-apis-graphql-schema-stitching-part-2/]

*Based on these findings I think approach #1 (accessing Contentful’s CDA API from the BE) is the simplest one to implement*

column26: Users need a visual indicator to understand how far they have progressed through within each dimension of the survey and how much is left on the page.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user of the survey

*I want…*to see a progress bar at the top of the survey page that updates as I scroll

*So that…*I can easily track my progress through each section of the survey.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

* Implementing a progress bar that dynamically updates as the user scrolls through the survey section.


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

* *Given* a survey section,
* *When* the user starts scrolling down the page,
* *Then* the progress bar at the top of the page should dynamically update to reflect the scroll position.



* *Given* a survey section,
* *When* the user scrolls to the bottom of the page,
* *Then* the progress bar should be fully filled, indicating 100% completion of that section.



* *Given* a survey section,
* *When* the user scrolls back up the page,
* *Then* the progress bar should decrease accordingly to reflect the current scroll position.



* *Given* a survey section with a progress bar,
* *When* the user is not scrolling (static position),
* *Then* the progress bar should accurately reflect the user's current position on the page.



* *Given* the progress bar,
* *When* the user scrolls quickly through the section,
* *Then* the progress bar should smoothly and accurately update in real-time to reflect the user's scroll position.*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column26: Integrating the survey with HubSpot will allow for efficient data collection, follow-up communications, and automated reminders to improve response rates and engagement.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user of the survey

*I want…*my survey data to be integrated with HubSpot

*So that…*my responses and contact information are collected, and I receive timely emails for reminders, survey completion, and results.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

Integration with HubSpot for data collection

* sending reminder emails
* push for answers
* sending out survey results.


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

* *Given* the survey landing page,
* *When* a user submits their contact information,
* *Then* their data should be automatically sent to HubSpot and stored as a new contact record.



* *Given* the survey completion,
* *When* a user submits their final responses,
* *Then* HubSpot should trigger an email to the user with a thank you message and a prompt that results will be discussed in a follow-up conversation.



* *Given* the survey data,
* *When* HubSpot receives the user data and responses,
* *Then* it should update the contact records with their AI readiness scores and dimension-specific insights.



* *Given* the HubSpot system,
* *When* setting up email campaigns for reminders,
* *Then* the system should use user data to personalize emails, including their first name and company name.



* *Given* the survey's integration with HubSpot,
* *When* preparing to send survey results,
* *Then* the email system should generate personalized PDF reports and attach them to the emails sent from HubSpot.



To validate:

* *_Given_* _the HubSpot integration,_
* *_When_* _a user starts the survey but doesn't complete it,_
* *_Then_* _we can automate a reminder emails should be sent from HubSpot at predefined intervals to encourage completion._
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*

* overview of the similar project Pete Davies mentioned that they are working with a 3rd party (Articulate) and includes hubspot integration - [https://hubs.ly/Q02sJtj30|https://hubs.ly/Q02sJtj30]

# *API Integration:*
#* Use HubSpot’s API to create and update contact records based on survey responses.
#* Ensure secure API calls to avoid data breaches.
# *Data Mapping:*
#* Map survey input fields to corresponding HubSpot properties (e.g., first name, last name, email, job title, company name, sector, size).
#* Map survey responses to custom properties in HubSpot to store AI readiness scores and other insights.
# *Automated Workflows:*
#* Set up workflows in HubSpot to automate reminder emails for incomplete surveys.
#* Automate thank you emails and follow-up messages upon survey completion.
# *Email Personalisation:*
#* Utilize HubSpot’s personalization tokens to include user-specific details (first name, company name) in email templates.
#* Ensure the design and content of emails align with branding guidelines.
# *PDF Report Generation:*
#* Develop a system to generate PDF reports based on survey responses.
#* Integrate with HubSpot to attach these reports to emails sent upon survey completion.
# *Data Security and Compliance:*
#* Ensure all data handling complies with GDPR and other relevant data protection regulations.
#* Implement encryption and secure storage practices for sensitive user data.
# *Error Handling:*
#* Implement robust error handling to manage API call failures and data sync issues.
#* Provide fallback mechanisms to retry or log errors for later review.
{panel}

column26: The Personalized Thank You Message on Results Page feature enhances user satisfaction by dynamically incorporating the participant's first name into the thank you message displayed on the results page. This customization adds a personal touch to the survey experience and strengthens the connection between the participant and the survey initiative.

column1: Questions Page - Personalised with company name
column26: The Personalized Survey Questions with Company Name feature enhances user engagement by dynamically replacing generic company references in survey questions with the name provided by the participant on the landing page. This customization creates a more personalized experience for survey participants and increases their sense of relevance and involvement in the survey process.

column1: Landing Page - Input fields Component and Form
column26: Implementing input fields for user data entry is essential for collecting relevant information from survey participants. By including fields we gather valuable data for analysis and engagement purposes, ultimately enhancing the effectiveness of the survey.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*possible prospect client

*I want…*to be able to enter my data into input fields on the AI Readiness Survey Landing Page,

*So that…*I can provide the necessary information for survey participation
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Implementation of input fields for users to enter their data, all fields are required:
#* First name
#* Last name
#* Job title
#* Email address - validate email (no business email required, just simple validations of email format)
#* Company name
#* Sector - dropdown:
#** _Automotive_
#** _Banking and Financial Services_
#** _Construction and Real Estate_
#** _Education_
#** _Healthcare and Pharmaceuticals_
#** _Information Technology and Services_
#** _Manufacturing_
#** _Retail and Consumer Goods_
#** _Telecommunications_
#** _Transport and Logistics_
#** _Other_
#* Size - dropdown:
#** _1-10 employees_
#** _11-50 employees_
#** _51-200 employees_
#** _201-500 employees_
#** _501-1,000 employees_
#** _1,001-5,000 employees_
#** _5,001-10,000 employees_
#** _> 10,000 employees_
#* Opt in check box + text
# Validation of email address input to ensure format compliance.
# Provision of dropdown menus for sector and size inputs, with predefined lists provided for selection.



*Out of scope:*

* Advanced data validation beyond email address format checking.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Given* I access the AI Readiness Survey Landing Page, *When* I view the data entry section, *Then* I should see input fields for first name, last name, job title, email address, company name, sector, and size.

*Given* I enter my email address into the designated field, *When* I submit the form, *Then* I should receive an error message if the email address format is invalid.

*Given* I select a value from the dropdown menu, *When* I submit the form, *Then* I should see the selected value included in the submitted data.

*Given* I submit the form without entering all required fields, *When* I attempt to proceed, *Then* I should receive error messages prompting me to complete all required fields.

*Given* I enter valid data into all required fields, *When* I submit the form, *Then* I should see a confirmation message indicating successful submission of my data.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column26: Aligning the survey pages with our company's design system reinforces our brand identity and creates a seamless user experience. By adhering to established design guidelines, we enhance user trust, recognition, and engagement with the AI Readiness Survey, ultimately contributing to the success of our initiative.

Offering the ability to save the survey progress addresses the needs of customers who may not have the time to complete the survey in one sitting. By allowing customers to pick up where they left off, we enhance usability and reduce frustration, ultimately increasing survey completion rates and data accuracy.

column1: Results Page - Personalised High-Level Roadmap Component with AI
column26: The Personalised Roadmap component provides customers with tailored recommendations and next steps based on their survey responses. It adds value to the Results page by offering customers practical guidance and actionable insights derived from their survey responses. By providing personalised recommendations, it empowers customers to take informed actions to enhance their organisation's AI readiness capabilities.

The Scoring Graphic Component is a visual representation of the customer's survey scoring displayed on the Results page. It enhances the user experience by presenting survey results in a visually appealing format, making it easier for customers to interpret and analyse their performance. By providing a clear visual representation, it helps customers identify areas of strength and areas for improvement in their AI readiness journey.

The AI-Powered Personalized Roadmap Component enhances the Client Partnerships Dashboard by integrating AI capabilities to generate personalized follow-up recommendations for clients. Leveraging AI algorithms and input data from the AI Readiness Survey, this component provides tailored next steps and action plans aligned with client industry, size, and survey results, enhancing the CP team's ability to engage with clients effectively.

By leveraging AI to analyze survey data and generate personalized roadmaps, the CP team can strengthen client relationships, drive value-added conversations, and provide strategic guidance aligned wit
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*member of the Client Partnerships (CP) team

*I want…*an AI-powered personalised roadmap component within the Client Partnerships Dashboard

*So that…*I can provide tailored follow-up recommendations to clients based on AI Readiness Survey results and input dat
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Integration of AI algorithms to analyze AI Readiness Survey results and input data (define data).
# Incorporation of AND knowledge base content with internal next steps and best practices for client engagement. - content [here|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uvIrgFG5_IJtTflKCWOv7W1QagR6S-EqqjD0TfZaBlE/edit#gid=499128068]
# Development of a personalised roadmap generation module within the Client Partnerships Dashboard.
# Dynamic generation of tailored next steps and action plans based on survey insights and client attributes.
# Implementation of visualisation to present personalised roadmaps in an intuitive and user-friendly manner.

*Out of scope:*

* Customisation options for individual client preferences or specific client scenarios beyond the scope of AI recommendations.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

+*Scenario 1*+

*Given* I access the Client Partnerships Dashboard, 

*When* I navigate to the AI-Powered Personalised Roadmap Component, 

*Then* I should see an interface with a personalised roadmap based on survey insights and client attributes.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*

* Integration of AI models for natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) to analyze survey data and generate personalized recommendations.
* Utilization of backend infrastructure for data processing, AI model inference, and personalized roadmap generation.
* Implementation of frontend components to display personalized roadmaps within the Client Partnerships Dashboard, utilizing visualization libraries or frameworks.
* Consideration of data privacy and security measures for handling sensitive client information and survey results within the AI-powered component.
{panel}

column26:
The Client Partnerships Dashboard for Survey Results Analysis feature enables members of the CP team to access and analyze AI Readiness Survey results internally. The dashboard provides aggregated data on survey scores per dimension, scores per industry, scores per company size, and other relevant metrics derived from survey input data, facilitating informed decision-making and client engagement strategies.

By leveraging insights from the dashboard, the CP team can tailor engagement strategies, identify opportunities for collaboration, and strengthen client partnerships effectively.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*member of the Client Partnerships (CP) team

*I want…*to access a dashboard displaying AI Readiness Survey results for internal analysis

*So that…*I can gain insights into client readiness across dimensions, industries, company sizes, and other relevant factors.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Development of a dashboard interface displaying AI Readiness Survey results.
# Aggregation and visualisation of survey scores by dimension average.
# Implementation of filters and sorting options for data exploration and analysis.
# Inclusion of additional metrics or visualisations based on input data from the survey, such as trend analysis, demographic breakdowns, and actionable insights.



*Out of scope:*

* Real-time data updates beyond the scope of survey completion.
* Integration with external systems or databases for data storage or retrieval.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Given* I am a member of the CP team, 

*When* I access the Client Partnerships Dashboard for Survey Results Analysis, 

*Then* I should see a user-friendly interface displaying aggregated survey results.



*Given* I view the dashboard, 

*When* I select a specific metric from the menu, 

*Then* I should see survey scores aggregated and visualized by metric.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column1: Email with Results as a pdf
column26: The Email with Results Page as PDF enables customers to receive their survey results, including scoring and personalised roadmap, directly in their email inbox as a PDF attachment. This allows customers to access and review their results offline and easily share them with relevant stakeholders within their company.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user that just completed the AI readiness survey

*I want…*to receive the Results Page in a PDF format via email

*So that…*I can easily review my survey scoring and personalised roadmap offline and share it within my company.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Integration with external email service providers for email delivery - hubspot
# Development of functionality to generate a PDF document.
# Inclusion of survey scoring and personalised roadmap information in the PDF document.

According to pdf template attached.



*Out of scope:*

* Customisation options for the content or layout of the PDF document
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Given* I have completed the AI Readiness Survey,
*When* I click the "See Results" button on the final section of the survey,
*Then* I should receive an email containing the Results Page in PDF format as an attachment.

*Given* I open the email containing the Results Page PDF attachment,
*When* I view the PDF document,
*Then* I should see my survey scoring and personalised roadmap information presented accurately and clearly.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*

* 
{panel}

column26: The Results page serves as the culmination of the AI Readiness Survey experience, offering customers actionable insights and support to guide their AI adoption journey. By providing visual representations of survey results, along with personalized recommendations and easy access to customer support, we aim to empower customers with the knowledge and resources needed for successful AI implementation.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user that just completed the survey

*I want…*to see my instant results in a final page

*So that…*I can view my scoring in a graphic format, receive a high-level roadmap, and easily contact AND for next steps
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Development of the Results page that includes a thank you message (content to be provided)
# Display survey scoring in a graphic format (personalised graphic developed [ARS-8|https://anddigitaltransformation.atlassian.net/browse/ARS-8])
# Integration of a high-level roadmap based on survey responses. (personalised content developed on [ARS-9|https://anddigitaltransformation.atlassian.net/browse/ARS-9])
# Inclusion of a button on the Results page to facilitate easy contact with the client partnership team. (content to be provided)

According to the designs attached.



*Out of scope:*

* Detailed analysis or breakdown of survey responses beyond high-level scoring
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Given* I am on the Results page,
*When* I view the page,
*Then* I should see a thank you message

*And* my survey scoring displayed in a graphic format

*And* a high level roadmap according to designs.

*And* a button or info to initiate contact with the client partnerships team for further next steps.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column1: Questions Page - Dimensions Progress Bar Component
column26:
The progress bar is a visual indicator that accompanies customers throughout the AI Readiness Survey, providing a clear representation of their progress and current position within the survey. It remains visible across all survey sections. 

The progress bar enhances the user experience by providing customers with a sense of orientation and progress visibility as they navigate through the survey. By maintaining consistent visibility across all survey sections, it ensures customers remain engaged and motivated to complete the questionnaire.
column299:
{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*GOAL*

*As a…*user of the survey

*I want…*to have a progress bar visible across the entire survey

*So that…*I can track my progress and understand my position within the survey across all sections/dimensions
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*SCOPE*

*In scope:*

# Development of a progress bar component that is visible across all survey sections.
# Integration of the progress bar into the survey interface to ensure continuous visibility.
# Design of the progress bar to accurately reflect the customer's progress through the survey, updating dynamically as they move from one section to another.
# Adapt and implement the progress bar for the responsiveness option too.

According to designs attached.



*Out of scope:*

* Dynamic adjustments to the progress bar based on customer responses within each section
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*

*Given* I am accessing the Survey,
*When* I begin the first section,
*Then* I should see a progress bar displayed according to the designs.

*Given* I am progressing through the Survey sections,
*When* I move from one survey section to another,
*Then* I should see the progress bar update dynamically to reflect my current position within the survey.

*Given* I am completing the AI Readiness Survey,
*When* I reach the end of the survey,
*Then* I should see the progress bar indicate full completion.

*Given* I can navigate back and forth between survey sections,
*When* I return to a previous section,
*Then* I should see the progress bar accurately reflect my progress based on the sections I am in.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*TECH CONSIDERATIONS*
{panel}

column26: The Survey Questions Pages provides a structured questionnaire and guides customers through the survey process, allowing customers to progress through the AI Readiness Survey seamlessly.  Customers will be directed to the first section of the survey, where they can answer questions related to the first dimension of AI readiness and from there on till completion. These pages include a progress bar, seven sections corresponding to each dimension, a summary of each dimension, the respective questions, buttons to navigate between sections, error handling for unanswered questions, and a "See Results" button at the last section.

The AI Readiness Survey Landing Page serves as the entry point for users to engage with our AI readiness assessment tool. This landing page will provide high-level information about the purpose of the survey and its expected results. Users will have the ability to input their data, opt in to participate in the survey, and access the survey through a designated button.
